title: Advanced Features
content: # Advanced Features  Explore the powerful capabilities of Cruella beyond basic Markdown rendering.  ## Front Matter Metadata  Every Markdown file can include YAML front matter:  ```yaml title: My Document author: John Doe date: 2025-11-08 tags: tutorial, documentation ```  Currently supported fields: - `title` â€“ Page/document title (fallback: filename)  ## Table of Contents  TOCs are automatically generated: - **HTML pages**: 3 levels deep - **Slides**: 2 levels deep  Example structure:  ### Level 1 Heading #### Level 2 Heading ##### Level 3 Heading  ## Search Functionality  The search bar in the sidebar performs live substring matching across: - Document titles - Full content text  ### How It Works  1. Plugin generates `index.json` from all Markdown files 2. Client-side JavaScript loads the index 3. User input triggers instant filtering 4. Results link directly to pages  ### Future Enhancements  - Fuzzy matching with Lunr.js - Search highlighting - Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+K) - Advanced filters (tags, dates)  ## Dark Mode  Toggle between light and dark themes: - Button in top-right corner - Preference saved in localStorage - Respects system preference on first visit - Smooth transitions  ### Color Variables  Customize themes in `style.css`:  ```css :root {   --accent: #4f8cff;   --sidebar-bg: #222b3a; }  :root.dark {   --accent: #4f8cff;   --sidebar-bg: #121a24; } ```  ## Presentation Slides  Enhanced with Reveal.js plugins:  ### Syntax Highlighting  ```python # Code blocks are automatically highlighted def fibonacci(n):     if n <= 1:         return n     return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2) ```  ### Speaker Notes  Add notes below slide content:  ```markdown ## Slide Title  Content visible to audience.  ::: notes These notes are only visible in speaker view. Press 'S' to open speaker view. ::: ```  ### Keyboard Shortcuts  - **Arrow keys**: Navigate slides - **S**: Speaker view - **F**: Fullscreen - **Esc**: Overview mode - **Ctrl+Shift+F**: Search slides  ## Plugin System  ### Built-in Plugins  #### 1. Search Index Builder - **File**: `plugins/build_search_index.sh` - **Purpose**: Generates `index.json` for search - **Dependencies**: `jq`  #### 2. Build Timestamp - **File**: `plugins/example_postprocess.sh` - **Purpose**: Adds invisible timestamp to HTML - **Dependencies**: None  ### Creating Custom Plugins  Example: Extract tags from front matter  ```bash #!/bin/sh # plugins/extract_tags.sh set -e  MARKDOWN_DIR="${MARKDOWN_DIR:-./content}" HTML_DIR="${HTML_DIR:-./public}"  for md in "$MARKDOWN_DIR"/*.md; do   [ -e "$md" ] || continue      tags=$(awk '     BEGIN{inmeta=0}     /^---$/{ if(inmeta==0){inmeta=1;next}else{exit} }     inmeta==1 && $0 ~ "^tags:" {       sub("^tags:[ ]*", ""); print; exit     }' "$md")      if [ -n "$tags" ]; then     echo "$(basename "$md"): $tags"   fi done ```  ### Plugin Best Practices  1. **Exit gracefully** if dependencies missing 2. **Use environment variables** for paths 3. **Print clear log messages** 4. **Be idempotent** (safe to run multiple times) 5. **Handle errors** without breaking the build  ## Watch Mode  Live rebuild on file changes using `entr`:  ```bash ./bin/cruella watch ```  ### How It Works  1. Monitors `content/*.md` files 2. Triggers `build_all.sh` on change 3. Logs rebuild timestamp 4. Continues watching  ### Tips  - Use with `serve.sh` for live preview - Add `content/**/*.md` to watch subdirectories (future enhancement) - Restart watch if you add new files  ## Accessibility Features  ### Keyboard Navigation  - **Skip link**: Jump to main content (Tab from page load) - **Focus indicators**: High-contrast outlines - **Tab order**: Logical sequence  ### Semantic HTML  - `<main>` for content area - `<aside>` for sidebar - `<nav>` for navigation - `<article>` for document body  ### ARIA Labels  - Search input: `aria-label="Search content"` - Search results: `aria-live="polite"` - Theme toggle: `aria-label="Toggle dark mode"`  ### Screen Reader Support  - Proper heading hierarchy (h1 â†’ h2 â†’ h3) - Alt text for images (author responsibility) - Table headers with `<th>`  ## Build Optimization  ### Reducing Build Time  1. **Incremental builds** (roadmap) 2. **Parallel processing** (future) 3. **Skip unchanged files** (future) 4. **Cache PDF builds** (future)  ### Output Size  - HTML: ~15KB per page (minified CSS) - PDF: ~80KB per document - Slides: ~25KB per deck  ### Performance Tips  - Optimize images before adding to content - Use WebP format for photos - Lazy load images with Pandoc filters - Enable gzip compression on server  ## Deployment Options  ### GitHub Pages  ```yaml # .github/workflows/deploy.yml name: Deploy on:   push:     branches: [main] jobs:   build-deploy:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest     steps:       - uses: actions/checkout@v3       - name: Build         run: |           sudo apt-get install -y pandoc jq           ./bin/cruella build html       - name: Deploy         uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3         with:           github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}           publish_dir: ./public ```  ### Netlify  Create `netlify.toml`:  ```toml [build]   command = "bin/cruella build html"   publish = "public"  [[plugins]]   package = "@netlify/plugin-lighthouse" ```  ### Docker  ```dockerfile FROM pandoc/latex:latest WORKDIR /workspace COPY . . RUN apk add --no-cache bash entr jq CMD ["./bin/cruella", "build", "all"] ```  Build and run:  ```bash docker build -t cruella . docker run -v $(pwd)/output:/workspace/public cruella ```  ## Troubleshooting  ### Common Issues  #### Pandoc Not Found ```bash # Ubuntu/Debian sudo apt-get install pandoc  # macOS brew install pandoc ```  #### LaTeX Errors in PDF ```bash # Install TeX Live sudo apt-get install texlive-xetex  # Or use minimal engine pandoc --pdf-engine=pdflatex input.md -o output.pdf ```  #### Watch Mode Not Working ```bash # Install entr sudo apt-get install entr  # Or macOS brew install entr ```  #### Search Not Working ```bash # Install jq sudo apt-get install jq  # Rebuild to generate index ./bin/cruella build html ```  ### Debug Mode  Add `set -x` to shell scripts for verbose output:  ```bash #!/bin/sh set -ex  # Enable debug trace ```  ## Next Steps  - Review the [Roadmap](roadmap.md) for future features - Check [Enhancements](enhancements.md) for full feature list - Join the community (GitHub Discussions)   **Questions?** Open an issue on GitHub!

title: Getting Started with Cruella
content: # Welcome to Cruella  Cruella is a **multi-format documentation generator** that transforms Markdown files into beautiful HTML, PDF, and presentation slides.  ## Features  - ðŸŽ¨ Dark/Light theme toggle - ðŸ” Client-side search - ðŸ“± Responsive design - ðŸ”Œ Plugin system - âš¡ Watch mode for live rebuilds  ## Quick Start  ### Installation  ```bash # Install dependencies sudo apt-get install pandoc texlive-xetex entr jq  # Clone repository git clone https://github.com/gongahkia/cruella.git cd cruella ```  ### Build Commands  ```bash # Build all formats ./bin/cruella build all  # Build individual formats ./bin/cruella build html ./bin/cruella build pdf ./bin/cruella build slides  # Watch mode (auto-rebuild) ./bin/cruella watch  # Serve locally ./bin/cruella serve public 8080 ```  ## Writing Content  Create Markdown files in the `content/` directory with optional YAML front matter:  ```markdown title: My Amazing Document  # Heading  Your content here... ```  ## Plugin Development  Plugins are executable shell scripts in `plugins/` directory:  ```bash #!/bin/sh # Example plugin echo "Hello from plugin!" ```  Make it executable:  ```bash chmod +x plugins/my_plugin.sh ```  ## Code Examples  ### Python  ```python def greet(name):     """Say hello to someone."""     return f"Hello, {name}!"  print(greet("Cruella")) ```  ### JavaScript  ```javascript const calculateSum = (a, b) => {   return a + b; };  console.log(calculateSum(5, 3)); ```  ## Tables  | Feature | HTML | PDF | Slides | |---------|------|-----|--------| | Dark Mode | âœ… | âŒ | âŒ | | Search | âœ… | âŒ | âœ… | | TOC | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |  ## Blockquotes  > "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication."   > â€” Leonardo da Vinci  ## Next Steps  1. Read the [Enhancements Documentation](../generated_docs/enhancements.md) 2. Check out the [Roadmap](../generated_docs/roadmap.md) 3. Start creating your content!   **Happy documenting! ðŸš€**
